attributes.action: Amend the proposed route of HS2, to follow the route of the A42 near to Measham.
attributes.background: The HS2 proposed route has been recently amended. Previously, it followed the existing course of the A42 dual carriageway to the north west of the villiage of Measham. The new proposal takes a route to the south east, passing through housing estates and recreational areas and walkways. Used by many.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hs2-route-to-the-east-midlands-leeds-and-manchester-set-out-by-the-government

attributes.action: Make a pensions treaty with South Korea for British people in Korea.
attributes.background: I have been working in Korea for nearly 10 years, and for nearly 8 of those years, I contributed over GBP10,000 to the nation pension scheme in South Korea. However, because there is no treaty for pensions between South Korea and the UK, I am unable to receive that money back in any way.
attributes.additional_details: I also have a number of friends who are in a similar predicament. If we contribute for 10 years to the scheme, we can get it when we are 65. But any less than that and we receive nothing. For me to receive any money at retirement, I would need to work in a private institute for 3 more years possibly, which for me is undesirable.
attributes.creator_name: Mr. James Michael Suddrey BA (Hons); MA

attributes.action: Introduce tighter control of wild boar in the Forest of Dean
attributes.background: There is a lot of debate in the Forest of Dean with regards to wild boar which roam freely in the Forest and how they impact on our lives. Some people love them and some people don't. It is becoming more apparent the boar are causing a nuisance and are not just living deep in the Forest.
attributes.additional_details: Do we want tighter controls?

attributes.action: Accept the BSA's offer of integrating lone refugee children into private schools
attributes.background:
"More than 220,000 have arrived in Europe this year, seeking safety and a better future. One in three is a child." - Unicef

In May 2016, the BSA (Boarding School's Association) offered the government more than 80 fully-funded places in private schools across Britain. They have been unfilled. Why?
attributes.additional_details: As poignant images and testimonies from refugees who have sacrificed everything to make the arduous journey become ever more common, many choose to avert their eyes in fear of the realisation that they could have done more. The British Government is among those who could do more - for a nation which has long prided itself on charity and helping those less fortunate, the paltry number is a farce. Urge them to collaborate with the BSA to restore this nation as one of the world's leading lights.

attributes.action: Take the rail franchise away from Southern Rail and give it to the government!
attributes.background: Southern Rail has been giving worse and worse service for years and years! Trains are being delayed and cancelled too frequently and causing major disruption for commuters.  It is time for a new company to be given the franchise or better yet for the government to take control of the rail system.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been many cases for which people have been affected by Southern Rail!

Southern Rail could not get me back home to from London to Eastbourne one night for being short staffed. I had to travel to Brighton and then get a bus to Seaford where everything had then terminated. As a result one of my relatives had to pick me up in the middle of the night. This journey had taken me over 3 hours!

Other people I know have found their trains cancelled or delayed in 4 out of 5 journeys in a week!

attributes.action: Review Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs Widening Access claim process.
attributes.background: 1000's of NHS Professionals have been waiting for over a year for the HMRC to process refund claims. The HMRC should be set specific timeframes to process claims. There is evidence of inconsistent information being given by the HMRC to claimants and this is totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs (HMRC) has stated that NHS employed staff also in full-time education are exempt from Tax and NI up to an annual allowance on earnings of £15,480, whilst in training, provided they meet certain criteria. Claims for refunds of tax and NI can be made for the period September 1999 to March 2013. 

This process has not been advertised to NHS professionals. The HMRC has made and error collecting Tax/NI and should rightfully correct this with complete transparency.

attributes.action: Stop the privatisation of NHS Professionals
attributes.background: NHS Professionals is the in-house recruitment and staffing agency of the NHS. The government is planning to 'seek external investment' for the organisation - i.e. sell it off to a private, profit making company.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only would this hand a private company a successful NHS agency which makes a profit and has an effective monopoly on staffing, it would also divert crucial funds away from the NHS at a time when it is struggling more than ever with successive budget cuts and increasing pressure on services.

Private companies put profits before patients. The Government must not be allowed to sell off yet another part of our NHS.

attributes.action: Implement the 10 recommendations of the APPG Inquiry Into Quality of New Homes.
attributes.background: The poor quality of new homes is not new. (NHBC, Barker Review of 2004, Office of Fair Trading Market Study of Home Building in the UK October 2008, and more recently the APPG Inquiry 2016) Yet surprisingly, there has not been any legislation to force this industry to improve.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 93% of new home buyers (at least 100,000 a year) report problems to their housebuilder. Defects that could and should have been prevented. The APPG Report is quite clear, the industry needs to be forced to improve both the quality of new homes and the indifferent service suffered by those buying new homes.

As a minimum, the government must implement the APPG Inquiry's “Key Recommendation” - the setting up of a New Homes Ombudsman by the DCLG within 3 months.

attributes.action: To make the A52, A15, A16, A17 in to dual carriage ways
attributes.background: The road systems in Lincolnshire have long been neglected resulting in unsafe potholes, faded road markings and an increase in road traffic collisions over the years. Due to the growth in population and industry the road in Lincolnshire simply cannot cope.
attributes.additional_details: By converting the four major roads throughout Lincolnshire into dual carrigeways this may potentially reduce traffic congestion within the main towns, decrease the risk of road incidents and encourage safer trade within the county. Within a year the A15 alone has seen an increase in road traffic fatalities due to an increase of vehicles on the roads - a dual carriageway on this particular road may make life easier for thriving agricultural and industrial businesses but it could also save lives.

attributes.action: UK to offer free trade deals with any EU country that votes out in a referendum
attributes.background: With the EU starting to fall apart now is the time for the UK Government to offer the EU countries who are about to hold their own In/Out referendums the help and understanding they deserve by offering them a open trade deal with Great Britain if they vote for an exit.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition will have the effect of showing the world we are standing on our own two feet and ready to trade as normal with everybody who is free to trade with us, without the shackles of corrupt trade dictatorships.
It will also send a strong message to those silly billies who want a second referendum, a vote in parliament etc, and continue, in the face of our improving prospects to still continue to run down the UK in order to satisfy their own power aspirations and personal gain.

attributes.action: Allow women with step children to have fertility treatment on the nhs
attributes.background: My Husband has a 10 year old from a previous relationship. I have no children. We have been trying for a baby for 2 years and due to my husband having a child we are not entitled to full fertility tests or treatments on the nhs. I feel as though I am being punished for his past relationship failing.
attributes.additional_details:
We can only have base line testing this means just blood tests to check hormones and a scan to check for cysts etc and a sperm check we are not entitled to any other tests or actual treatment. I feel so alone and like no one will help me in this journey to be a Mum. Every month is devastating and feel so depressed each time we are unsuccessful.
If the reason I felt like this was because I had small breasts I would be entitled to bigger ones on the nhs. But I'm not entitled to help for a baby.

attributes.action: Change regulations for fathers who lose a child to stillbirth or neonatal death
attributes.background: Currently if a fathers child dies due to stillbirth or neonatal death they are only entitled to what their employer feels is required in terms of compassionate leave.  While a mother is fully entitled and rightly so to the full maternity leave.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the father should be entitled to take and or share the maternity leave with his partner. These are extreme circumstances and should be looked at as such. When it comes to dealing with the death of a child, your gender does not come in to it. I am writing from personal experience as my son Zachary was stillborn at 11 days overdue on April 2nd 2013.
I was treated extremely badly and inappropriately by my employer after having sick leave due to the death if my son.

attributes.action: Stop trading & supporting India until it stops human rights violation in Kashmir
attributes.background: Draconian laws such as AFSPA & PSA are used by India to commit human rights violations in Kashmir with impunity, over last 44 days of worst curfew imposed in Kashmir, Indian forces have killed over 70+ civilians, 200+ blinded using pellets, including young kids as young as 1 year, injured 8000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Insha, 14 year old is battling for her life due to serious brain injury after been hit by pellets aimed deliberately at upper body.

Essentials supplies like food, water & medicine have been curtailed, communication restricted, an ambulance driver shot while transporting patient to hospital, Lecturer dragged from home and beaten to death. 

We people of Britain have an obligation to put an end to these human rights violations.

attributes.action: Repeal the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000, used by the BBC to snoop
attributes.background: The BBC uses the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000, passed by Tony Blair, to snoop on the public to maintain its enormous income and preserve its privileged position to control opinion in the UK, and prevent the public protesting in the only way it can against its biased reporting.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC has a charter to serve the public, and not its own elite. That BBC elite has used its monopoly position to influence the public in every election and has abandoned the original ethos of neutrality in providing information and news. If the public resent this then they should be able to vote with their wallets and the BBC should not be able to use the power of the state to oppress them fom exercising the free will that Englishmen thought was their birthright.

attributes.action: Stop allowing the NHS to go into decline, put it back  in the public domain
attributes.background: Private companies are charging extortionate fees which are being paid for with public money.  Voters should be asked how they want their money to be to be spent or if they want to use their money to pay for high managerial positions which could pay for training for doctors and nurses.
attributes.additional_details: The speed at which the NHS is being placed into private hands is steadily increasing with more  contracts going to private providers, even when the NHS contracts  cost less for the same services. The money to pay those private companies comes from public money which should be going to the support of the NHS.  By placing the NHS completely in the public hands, Where we are given the ability to make decisions on what happens to our Health Service people would have more respect on how it is used.

attributes.action: Any refugee claiming to be a child to have ID, age and criminal conviction tests
attributes.background:
To safeguard our children, teachers and other school workers (indeed everyone), we are calling for rigorous testing of all refugees claiming to be children. 
Dental checks must be carried out to ascertain age and police checks must be carried out for criminal convictions.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been cases were some refugees claiming to be children have been proved to be adults. This has had alarming consequences from commission of serious assaults to fraud where the refugee has claimed free education from the UK tax payer.
All UK citizens have a HUMAN RIGHT to be protected by our government and this type of testing will go some way to aiding this. 
There is obviously some urgency in the government responding to this and implementing rigorous checks before a tragedy happens.

attributes.action: Embed Armed Forces Covenant into law in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Armed Forces Covenant 2015 is a promise from the Nation to those who serve or have served in The Armed Forces and their Families to be treated fairly and should suffer no disadvantage due to their service. This promise is not being upheld Nationwide , the only recourse is for it to be made Law
attributes.additional_details: The Armed Forces Covenant has much to offer  Serving & Veterans of HMF unfortunately upholding the Covenant across United Kingdom is very inconsistent to the point in some areas of the Country it is not even acknowledged by local Government,NHS, ect causing some Veterans to become homeless and many others to continue to suffer injuries both physical & mental without adequate help or treatment at the moment enforcement of the Armed Forces Covenant is optional not Law a `promise` is not working .

attributes.action: British Parliment should not have a summer recess this year.
attributes.background: They should stay and work through the issues raised by BREXIT. This important to keep our economy stable throughout theses political changes .  Individuals should be able to take time off for family holidays, but for limited periods.

attributes.action: RAISE ISSUE OF PERSECUTION OF POLITICAL ACTIVISTS WITH MUGABE REGIME IN ZIMBABWE
attributes.background: We ask the UK govt to raise the issue of persecution of activists with the Zimbabwe govt. The last election was hugely rigged. Misgovernance & corruption have destroyed the economy resulting in starvation & 90% unemployment. Civil unrest is growing & protesters refused bail & jailed without trial.
attributes.additional_details: Linda Masarira, locked up since 6 July on trumped-up charges, has health problems & is the mother of 5 children (youngest 2 yrs). Accused of inciting riots in the female section of Chikurubi prison on 10/9, she was moved to solitary confinement in the dangerous male section – we fear for her safety. Other activists are also still incarcerated, many needing medical care after violent treatment by the police. Both Gift Siziba’s hands are believed to be broken.  This vicious persecution must stop.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a business or service provider to ban guide dogs.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence for taxis or private hire drivers to refuse to carry guide or assistance dogs, unless they hold an exemption. This petition calls for parity so the same applies to businesses and service providers. We also call for police to be the prosecuting authority via magistrates court
attributes.additional_details: Currently, unlike for taxis and private hire cars, the law doesn't specifically say guide and assistance dogs must be admitted. This is wrong and leads to confusion. Moreover, other than for taxis. Matters are dealt with personally by the victim, at their cost via the county court. This is not the case for other types of discrimination. We call for a prosecuting authority to take the cases on, on behalf of the Crown.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as P.M
attributes.background: Theresa May has had a one house race to become prime minister without anyone voting for her outside of parliament. Therefor a General Election should be called within 1 year.

attributes.action: Require a referendum before any decision on the privatisation of public services
attributes.background: In recent times the Post Office has been sold to private ownership and it would seem that the NHS is being sold in small increments currently. All of this happens without the confirmation of the UK voting population. A referendum would, at the least, raise a large amount of awareness to the public.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the C of E to discriminate against gay non-celibate clergy
attributes.background: The Anglican Church insists that gay clergy with partners live a celibate life if they wish to continue working as priests or bishops. This is an unfair burden on gay clergy as well as being discriminatory within the 21st century workplace.

attributes.action: Continue to allow reciprocal freedom of movement with EU member states
attributes.background: Freedom of movement has been a fact of life for Brits and Europeans for many years. It's a vital source of economic & social mobility for individuals, and one which benefits UK businesses & cuts red tape. Future generations should not be deprived of this right.

attributes.action: to make immigrants work and pay tax for 4 years before they can claim benefits.
attributes.background: this is one of the big reasons why people chose to voted out of the EU, we have now chosen to leave the EU and we should no longer be giving immigrants housing benefits, working tax credits or job seekers allowance from a system that they have never paid into. This should be stoped immediately.
attributes.additional_details: we have a great benefits system that is here to help British citizens, the system was not put in place to pay people money for doing nothing, if an immigrant wants to claim any benefits they should have been living, working and paying tax into the system for 4 years minimum before they can claim any benifits.

attributes.action: Take evidence and expert advice into account alongside the EU referendum result.
attributes.background: For the reasons outlined below we the undersigned request that parliament take into consideration evidence, data and facts from a panel of academics and experts on the benefits and cons of being in the EU before making a final decision on whether or not leave.
attributes.additional_details: Reasons: The EU referendum result is advisory not legally binding; The electorate is so evenly divided; The age demographic bias towards under 50's wanting to remain a member; The impact leaving will have on future generations currently unable to vote; The inaccuracy of some claims made by campaigners; The influence of possible media bias during campaigning; Lack of expertise and insight on key issues amongst the general public.

attributes.action: Include ADHD in the Disability Living Allowance SMI Criteria.
attributes.background: Make ADHD automatically an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain for Disability Living Allowance (Severe Mental Impairement Rules). Autism Spectrum Disorder is now automatically accepted as an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain, and ADHD should be too.
attributes.additional_details: ADHD comes little danger awareness and it is extremely hard to bring up a child who does not understand anything about danger, this means they need more help when out and about. To pass the severe mental impairment part of DLA you need to have an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain. ADHD is exactly that however, it is not automatically classed as that. I feel like this condition is too overlooked and we are still stuck in the dark ages regarding our views on it.

attributes.action: Allow the Help to Buy ISA bonus to be used for deposits for first-time buyers.
attributes.background:
The Help to Buy ISA was set up by the government to help first-time buyers. However the money the government puts in cannot be used as part of the deposit.

As the scheme is supposed to help first-time buyers, the money should be usable for the deposit helping people get on the housing ladder!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-08-20/help-to-buy-isa-scandal-leaves-500-000-first-time-buyers-unable-to-use-scheme-for-deposits/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/19/help-to-buy-isa-scandal-500000-first-time-buyers-told-scheme-can/

attributes.action: Stop the roll out of grammar schools and work to close down current grammars
attributes.background: There has been speculation that the government are looking into lifting the ban on new grammar schools and this would create more inequality than social mobility. In areas where there are grammars, secondary schools receive a lot more Free School Meal funding etc. The grammar system doesn't work.
attributes.additional_details: I recently wrote to Cllr. Zahir Mohammad, Cabinet Member for Schools in Bucks, about funding inequalities between grammars and secondaries and his response was this, "The non-selective schools receive considerably more support from increased funding e.g. per pupil Free School meals, Prior Attainment, English as an additional language and Pupil Premium etc and this can be quite significantly more than grammars.". The 11+ is biased against poorer kids and this system cannot be rolled out further.

attributes.action: Do not bring in a fee/charge to use Recycling Centres nationwide
attributes.background: My local council and I am sure many will follow suit are planning to start charging for certain types of waste brought to the Recycling Centre. I would like the Government to stop this charge as I fear it will encourage fly tipping.

attributes.action: Support the establishment of a European Associate Citizenship for UK Citizens
attributes.background:
Charles Goerens, MEP, has tabled an amendment calling for Associate Citizenship of the EU to be offered to citizens of former EU member states. 

This proposal offers a realistic and worthwhile compromise for the 16,141,241 people who voted to remain, at no cost to the UK taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government has a responsibility to the millions of UK Citizens who voted remain. 

This petition calls on the Government to support the establishment of a European Associate Citizenship. Such a move would soften the blow of Brexit for those passionate about the European project, ensure the millions of UK citizens who live and work in the EU can continue the lives they have chosen, and would give future generations the option to live and work in Europe. 

It would cost the UK nothing.

attributes.action: Set a suitable, maximum waiting time for access to NHS mental health treatments
attributes.background: This petition forms the basis of the Campaign for Proper Mental Healthcare (https://propermentalhealthcare.com). The NHS is failing people with mental health problems. Waitings lists up to nearly a year and impersonal, generic assessments are not an appropriate treatment. The system needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: The Campaign for Proper Mental Healthcare is a website designed to share people's personal experiences with mental health services and treatments on the NHS. People are not getting the treatment they desperately need, leading to further feelings of helplessness and desperation. The system is not conducive to helping people effectively deal with and overcome depression, anxiety, or other mental health problems. A maximum waiting time of a matter of weeks would greatly improve this situation.

attributes.action: I call for a vote of NO CONFIDENCE in this government!
attributes.background: Brexit is causing chaos to the United Kingdom and it's citizens, it is clear, the referendum as presented to the voter was based on lies and exagerations and the government is still continuing this trend, this must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Not allowing parliment to vote on when article 50 will be presented, nor allowing the majority of the United Kingdom to have a rethink, now that they know the real implications of the result of the advisory referendum.

attributes.action: Introduce new traffic legislation to benefit motorbikes and emergency services.
attributes.background: Make it law that road users must move to the nearside in a traffic jam or when the traffic is stationery/slow moving, on multi lanes inner lanes move to the nearside and the outer lane move to the offside.   Allowing motorbikes and emergency services to filter/continue without risk of accident.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a motorbike rider of many years with an advanced riding certificate and a member of Blood bike Wales.  With more traffic users on the roads each year.  I find there to be the downturn/deterioration of courtesy and common sense within road users, more and more road users do not give way and sadly selfishly blocks the way of motorbike users during slow moving or stationary traffic.  

This would  increase safe passage for motorbikes and emergency services without affecting the road user!

attributes.action: Publish the identity of aircraft used to bomb hospitals in Syria
attributes.background:
On 29 July, unidentified aircraft bombed a maternity hospital in Syria supported by Save the Children.

As part of the Coalition against Daesh, the UK has data on military aircraft flights in Syria. Where data can identify aircraft used to bomb hospitals, the UK should publish their identity.
attributes.additional_details:
Physicians for Human Rights have documented 373 attacks on medical facilities in Syria.

Deliberate attacks on hospitals are a war crime. Those responsible should not be allowed any measure of deniability.

Background: https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/07/syria-fatal-airstrike-on-maternity-hospital-a-potential-war-crime/

attributes.action: Drop prescription fees for people with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: I am a 17 year old girl who has lived with and helped to look after my mum, who has suffered with Parkinson's Disease since 2007. I would like to petition again the fees of prescription charges for people with such diseases, after our local MP refused to help us.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a fee of £8.40 per item for medications, for someone like my mum who could pay a potential fee of £51.60 a month for a illness that she can not help, or can not be cured. With her "season ticket" she pays £132 a year!

In Scotland and Wales, prescriptions are free. Over 65's also do not pay, aswell as people with problems such as diabetes or thyroid disorders. 
This differs from people with chronic illnesses, who often can not work and get less money.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to wear a riding hat whilst riding on the roads.
attributes.background: There are some riders who choose not to wear a riding hat whilst riding on the roads. This choice could be a fatal one and if simple legislation can prevent more deaths on our roads to horse riders then it gets my vote!
attributes.additional_details: The impression it gives to other road users means they are less likely to pass you in a suitable manner. Riders struggle everyday to encourage drivers to slow down & pass them with care and attention. This legislation could save lives. A huge amount of riding accidents involve someone else coming to help the injured party.  The use of a riding hat has been proven to help prevent severe head injuries & it could mean a less traumatic experience for anyone involved with helping the injured rider.

attributes.action: Award QTS as part of EYITT
attributes.background: EYITT's have to meet the same entry requirements and the same set of rigorous standards as their counterparts who achieve QTS.
attributes.additional_details:
Without QTS, EYT's have found that they do not receive equal stature, pay or recognition for the demanding work that they carry out and their dedication, passion and commitment towards the teaching profession and children and families aged 0-5.

http://www.nurseryworld.co.uk/nursery-world/news/1159248/early-years-pay-and-conditions-survey-2016

https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/eligibility-for-teacher-training

attributes.action: Change the law. Make Civil & Family Judges accountable in law and to Parliament.
attributes.background: Most people do not know that currently Judges cannot be prosecuted for Judicial Acts. Most Judges are excellent, but some are not. This new law shall give us the people the right to challenge them. Only right in our modern society. Judges shall remain unelected yes, but accountable they must become.
attributes.additional_details:
This reform law shall make Judges accountable for Misconduct in Public Office if for example they fail to:

1 Disclose Conflicts of Interest with any person involved in a case they hear. 

2 Fail to inform the Police if they discover  evidence of crime in a Family or Civil case.

Secondly if a Civil Judge fails to adhere to, or enforce a Statute of Parliament, thus the will of Parliament, which is after all the will of the people, they can be brought to Parliament to face Contempt of Parliament

attributes.action: To create awareness and delvelop treatment on Temporomandibular Joint disorders
attributes.background:
The symptoms of TMJD include facial pain, reduced mouth opening and headaches which can be very debilitating. 

PURPOSE: 
- patients need to know which treatments they can access 
- to create more TMJD centers on the NHS in all regions of the UK, not just London
- more research into TMJD.
attributes.additional_details: TMJD affects approx. 25% of the population. There are very few NHS clinics which provide TMJD treatment in the UK compared to the USA even though there are NICE Guidelines set out for TMJD, most patients who do not know that treatment is available.

attributes.action: Pause, plan and review before a decision on Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty.
attributes.background:
1. Wait 4 to 6 months to allow the parties to resolve their internal conflicts.
2. Take steps to address the divisions that the referendum has revealed in our communities.
3. Hold an independent enquiry into allegations of disinformation during the campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
4. Establish a clear plan of what Brexit would entail; for example, movement of people, economic and trading relations, rights at work, environmental legislation and the future of Projects currently receiving EU funding.
5. This plan should be subject to public consultation and democratic process, including the views of 16 and 17 year olds before a final decision is taken about whether to enact Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty.

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Dangerous Dogs Act 1991'
attributes.background: Everyday innocent dogs around the UK are dragged from their homes, stuffed into kennel's with other petrified dogs away form their owners and are 'destroyed'. A large number of these dogs are just puppies and have never shown any signs of aggression. They are dying due to breed discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Its about time we started to realise that no dogs are dangerous, only owners. We have known this for centuries yet we still allow criminals to breed these types of animals excluded within the Dangerous Dogs Act and we have almost zero accountability over our pet owners within the United Kingdom. 

We must propose a new system in which owners/breeders are held accountable for their animal no matter what breed and encourage education rather than destruction with this issue.

attributes.action: Review the KS2 writing assessment criteria regarding spelling (before 30.06.16)
attributes.background: This year Y6 pupils have to meet criteria to reach the government's expected standard. All of it has to be met, as well as spelling, regardless of specific learning difficulties, including dyslexia. No matter how creative children are, they will not achieve the expected standard for their age.
attributes.additional_details:
We, as Y6 teachers, feel this will impact negatively on children's motivation to write and their self-esteem. This petition has been set up on behalf of such children who have worked hard all year, as well as parents who may not understand the consequences of this aspect of the education policy.
The government may say that children are allowed to use dictionaries, although this can stunt creativity and would not help children with spelling difficulties like dyslexia.

attributes.action: A second EU referendum including 16 and 17 year olds
attributes.background:
A second EU should be taken & open to 16 and 17 year olds. This vote has been much too close and doesn't take into consideration young people who will be most affected.
Fear mongering in the media has warped facts. The drop in value of the GBP (£) should be reason enough to revote with young people

attributes.action: Make the next Ofsted chief work as a classroom teacher for a term
attributes.background: The next proposed chief inspector of Ofsted, Amanda Spielman, should spend at least a term working as a classroom teacher prior to taking up the position. Someone who tells others how to teach and run education must come from a position of experience of doing the job.

attributes.action: Do not make the British taxpayer pay for the renovation of Buckingham Palace!
attributes.background: Following recent news that Buckingham Palace is to undergo a £369 million renovation, it should not be at the expense of the British taxpayer. In a time of perennial austerity where hospitals, schools and the "JAM" (just about managing) families are struggling, surely this renovation is arbitrary?
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/nov/18/buckingham-palace-to-undergo-370m-refurbishment
http://www.thetimes.co.uk/_TP_/edition/news/mps-urge-royals-to-chip-in-for-palace-repairs-6htfxxqpm?ni-statuscode=acsaz-307
http://www.ibtimes.co.in/no-taxpayers-money-britains-citizens-want-queen-elizabeth-pay-370-million-palace-repairs-704963

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum exclusively for 16 and 17-year olds.
attributes.background: The results of this second vote would be folded into the results of  the  general referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Given that the outcome of the European Union referendum will impact the younger generations for decades to come, and that 16 and 17-years old were denied the right to have a say in spite of having to bear the economic and political brunt of this decision, we propose that a second referendum be held exclusively for them. 
We also propose that the results of this second referendum be included with the results of the general referendum as a more accurate representation of the public will regarding membership of the E.U.

attributes.action: Make sports playing fields dog free areas - we need to protect our children.
attributes.background: I am a grassroots football coach and am becoming increasingly angered by the amount of time spent picking up dog faeces before training and matches. Talking to coaches from around the country this is a national problem. TIME TO BAN DOGS FROM ALL PLAYING FIELDS for the sake of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
My club in the East End of Newcastle have pushed hard to protect the kids, however the irresponsible dog owners appear at times that the wardens aren't around.
We have been highlighted in the Newcastle Evening Chronicle and some people have been fined but the practice of being ignorant by some people just doesn't stop.

attributes.action: Delay EU exit until referendum campaigns are fully investigated for truthfulness
attributes.background:
The recent referendum was characterised by lies and twisted truth, with newspaper retractions and fact-finding services being needed daily.

We need to know whether the British public were deliberately misled, by whom, and by how much, before committing to this monumental decision.

attributes.action: Discuss the competency of Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.
attributes.background: The Alexandra Hospital in Redditch is slowly being downgraded by the Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.  Why?
attributes.additional_details:
The people of Redditch, Studley and Bromsgrove are affected because:
The public transport links from Redditch to Worcester are poor.
Maternity and Paedeatrics have already closed at Redditch.
The consultants are leaving the Alexandra Hospital, so more wards are closing.
The parking at Worcester Royal Hospital is inadequate.
Worcester Royal Hospital cannot cope with more patients.

The government should launch an investigation into the Trusts finances and its actions to remove services from Redditch Alexandra in favour of Worcester Royal.
